info.title: vpc-api-product
info.description: APIs referentes ao produto de VPC

get.description: Return a detailed list of ports from the provided tenant_id

parameters.name: x-tenant-id
parameters.description: Tenant id of the project

schema.title: X-Tenant-Id
schema.description: Tenant id of the project

post.description: Create a Port on the default VPC. Uses VPC default in the provided x-tenant-id. You can provide a list of security_groups_id or subnets.

parameters.name: x-tenant-id
parameters.description: Tenant id of the project

schema.title: X-Tenant-Id
schema.description: Tenant id of the project

get.description: Returns a list of ports for a provided vpc_id and x-tenant-id. The list will be paginated, it means you can easily find what you need just setting the page number(_offset) and the quantity of items per page(_limit). The level of detail can also be set

parameters.name: vpc_id
parameters.description: ID of VPC to list ports

schema.title: vpc_id
schema.description: ID of VPC to list ports

parameters.name: _offset
parameters.description: Page Number

schema.title: Page Number
schema.description: Page Number

parameters.name: _limit
parameters.description: Items Per Page

schema.title: Items Per Page
schema.description: Items Per Page

parameters.name: x-tenant-id
parameters.description: Tenant id of the project

schema.title: X-Tenant-Id
schema.description: Tenant id of the project

post.description: Create async Public IP in a VPC with provided vpc_id and x_tenant_id

parameters.name: vpc_id
parameters.description: Id of the VPC to create the Public IP in

schema.title: Vpc ID
schema.description: Id of the VPC to create the Public IP in

parameters.name: validate_quota
parameters.description: Validate the quota before creating the Public IP

schema.title: validateQuota
schema.description: Validate the quota before creating the Public IP

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: The request will be asynchronous. The wait parameter tells the API that you want the request to simulate synchronous behavior (to maintain endpoint compatibility). You can set an approximate timeout with the waitTimeout parameter

schema.title: wait
schema.description: The request will be asynchronous. The wait parameter tells the API that you want the request to simulate synchronous behavior (to maintain endpoint compatibility). You can set an approximate timeout with the waitTimeout parameter

parameters.name: wait_timeout
parameters.description: the approximate time in seconds you want to wait when simulating the request as synchronous (only works with wait=true)

schema.title: waitTimeout
schema.description: the approximate time in seconds you want to wait when simulating the request as synchronous (only works with wait=true)

get.description: Returns a list of rules for a provided security_group_id

parameters.name: security_group_id
parameters.description: Id of the Security Group

schema.title: Security Group ID
schema.description: Id of the Security Group

parameters.name: x-tenant-id
parameters.description: Tenant id of the project

schema.title: X-Tenant-Id
schema.description: Tenant id of the project

post.description: Create a Rule async, returning its ID. To monitor the creation progress, please check the status in the service message or implement polling.Either a remote_ip_prefix or a remote_group_id can be specified.With remote_ip_prefix, all IPs that match the criteria will be allowed.With remote_group_id, only the specified security group is allowed to communicatefollowing the specified protocol, direction and port_range_min/max

parameters.name: security_group_id
parameters.description: Id of the Security Group

schema.title: Security Group ID
schema.description: Id of the Security Group

parameters.name: validate_quota
parameters.description: Validate the quota before creating Rule

schema.title: validateQuota
schema.description: Validate the quota before creating Rule

parameters.name: wait
parameters.description: The request will be asynchronous. The wait parameter tells the API that you want the request to simulate synchronous behavior (to maintain endpoint compatibility). You can set an approximate timeout with the waitTimeout parameter

schema.title: wait
schema.description: The request will be asynchronous. The wait parameter tells the API that you want the request to simulate synchronous behavior (to maintain endpoint compatibility). You can set an approximate timeout with the waitTimeout parameter

parameters.name: wait_timeout
parameters.description: the approximate time in seconds you want to wait when simulating the request as synchronous (only works with wait=true)

schema.title: waitTimeout
schema.description: the approximate time in seconds you want to wait when simulating the request as synchronous (only works with wait=true)

SubnetPoolDetailsResponse.title: SubnetPoolDetailsResponse
SubnetPoolDetailsResponse.description: A Pydantic model representing the request for creating one Subnet Pool.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the subnet pool.

pool_prefix.title: Pool Prefix
pool_prefix.description: The CIDR notation prefix for the subnet pool.

min_prefix_length.title: Min Prefix Length
min_prefix_length.description: The minimum prefix length for a subnet in the pool.

max_prefix_length.title: Max Prefix Length
max_prefix_length.description: The maximum prefix length for a subnet in the pool.

default_prefix_length.title: Default Prefix Length
default_prefix_length.description: The default prefix length for a subnet in the pool.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description for the subnet pool

address_scope_id.title: Address Scope Id
address_scope_id.description: The ID of the address scope for the subnet pool

SubnetPoolRequest.title: SubnetPoolRequest
SubnetPoolRequest.description: A Pydantic model representing the request for creating one Subnet Pool.

SubnetPoolResponse.title: SubnetPoolResponse
SubnetPoolResponse.description:
A Pydantic model representing a response for Subnet Pool creation.

Attributes:
    id (str): The ID of the subnet pool.
    tenant_id (str): The ID of the tenant that owns the subnet pool.
    vpc_id (str): The ID of the VPC that the subnet pool belongs to.
    name (str): The name of the subnet pool.
    external_id (str): The ID of the subnet pool in OpenStack.

SubnetPoolsResponse.title: SubnetPoolsResponse
SubnetPoolsResponse.description: A Pydantic model representing a list of Subnet Pools.

subnetpool_id.title: Subnetpool Id
subnetpool_id.description: ID of SubnetPool             from which the VPC will get CIDRs.             Can be used instead of 'cidr' field.

cidr.title: Cidr
cidr.description: CIDR from which VPC's subnets will get IPs            Can be used instead of 'subnetpool_id' field.

XVpcCreateRequest.title: XVpcCreateRequest
XVpcCreateRequest.description:
XVpcCreateRequest is the equivalent of VpcCreateRequest
for XaaS routes.
